TopicTitle: Two questions: Stability and creating maneuver nodes while paused...

Articles.Content:
I'm having a heck of a time getting a rather simple rocket into orbit. During my gravity turn, the rocket starts to swivel left/right, I have several stabilizers in the booster stage, and have stabilizer fins at the back to help with the turn. (I would post a list of parts, but I don't know how to do that in text form)

Either way, when I do manage to get a craft's AP above 80km, I can't set the maneuver node while the game is "paused" so that I have time to adjust it. When I do get one (running at normal speed), when I start adjusting the prograde handle, the perigee doesn't change and I see two crash sites on the surface. 

I'm sure I'm doing something wrong, but I can't for the life of me figure out what it is.

Any aid or suggestions would be greatly appreciated! Also, if you need anything from me to help solve my confusion, just let me know.

Thanks!

Another user ( @Scarecrow71 ) also reported on the inability to create maneuver nodes while the game is paused.  That is certainly a bug, and I would suspect it will be addressed at some point.  But for now, doesn't seem to work.

Oh, without seeing a pic of your rocket, hard to comment on stability issues.  However, if you have fins on an intermediate stage they could be causing some of your problems.
